Package game.modes

Class Simulation

java.lang.Object
game.modes.Simulation
All Implemented Interfaces:
SimulationI
Direct Known Subclasses:
AutomaticMode, ManualMode
public abstract class Simulation
extends java.lang.Object
implements SimulationI
The Simulation class represents the core functionality to simulate a strategic mission-based game. It provides methods and mechanisms to handle player actions, enemy movements, and overall game progression. The class manages the state of the simulation, including the battlefield, player status, mission objectives, and various other scenarios.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    Simulation​(Mission mission, Player player, Report report)
    Constructs a Simulation instance which initializes the game with the given mission, player, and report.

  • Constructor Details

    • Simulation

      public Simulation​(Mission mission, Player player, Report report)
      Constructs a Simulation instance which initializes the game with the given mission, player, and report.
      Parameters:
      mission - The mission associated with the simulation, containing details about the battlefield, enemies, and items.
      player - The player participating in the simulation.
      report - The report that will record the progress and outcomes of the simulation.

  • Method Details

    • movePlayer

      public abstract void movePlayer() throws ElementNotFoundException, EmptyCollectionException
      Moves the player to a new position within the simulation. This method is responsible for determining and executing the player's movement within the battlefield based on the current state of the game.
      Specified by:
      movePlayer in interface SimulationI
      Throws:
      ElementNotFoundException - if a required element, such as the target room or path, is not found during the movement process.
      EmptyCollectionException - if the collection used for determining the player's movement, such as paths or possible moves, is empty.

    • game

      public abstract void game() throws ElementNotFoundException, EmptyCollectionException
      Initiates and oversees the core gameplay loop within the simulation. This method is responsible for managing the sequential flow of a simulation session, executing actions and managing the state of the game until its conclusion. It integrates player actions, game state updates, and progression within the mission being simulated.
      Specified by:
      game in interface SimulationI
      Throws:
      ElementNotFoundException - if a required component within the simulation, such as a target, enemy, or room, cannot be located during the execution of the game logic.
      EmptyCollectionException - if an operation within the simulation attempts to access or manipulate an empty collection critical to the gameplay mechanics (e.g., paths, enemies, or items).

    • isReturningToExit

      public boolean isReturningToExit()
      Checks if the player is currently returning to the extraction point.
      Specified by:
      isReturningToExit in interface SimulationI
      Returns:
      true if the player is returning to the extraction point, false otherwise.

    • renderAutomaticSimulation

      public void renderAutomaticSimulation​(Player player, Target target) throws ElementNotFoundException
      Renders the automatic simulation by setting up the next objective, determining the best entry point, and positioning the player within the game. This method manages the initial setup and state configuration for an automated simulation process.
      Parameters:
      player - The player participating in the simulation. The player's position is updated to the calculated entry point as part of the simulation setup.
      target - The target object specifying the next objective room for the simulation. The objective room is set to guide the player's progression.
      Throws:
      ElementNotFoundException - If the entry point or required simulation element cannot be determined or located during initialization.

    • renderManualSimulation

      public void renderManualSimulation​(Room target)
      Prepares and starts a manual simulation for the given target room in the game. This involves setting the next objective, initializing the game state, and configuring the appropriate turn structure for the simulation.
      Parameters:
      target - The room that the player is tasked to move toward as the next objective in the manual simulation.

    • getReport

      public Report getReport()
      Retrieves the report associated with the current simulation.
      Returns:
      the report object that contains information about the progress, outcomes, and details of the simulation.

    • getBattleField

      public CustomNetwork<Room> getBattleField()
      Retrieves the battlefield associated with the current simulation. The battlefield is represented as a custom network of rooms where the simulation takes place.
      Specified by:
      getBattleField in interface SimulationI
      Returns:
      the CustomNetwork of Room objects representing the battlefield.

    • setGameOver

      public void setGameOver​(boolean gameOver)
      Sets the game over status for the simulation.
      Specified by:
      setGameOver in interface SimulationI
      Parameters:
      gameOver - A boolean indicating whether the game is over. If true, the simulation is marked as completed.

    • getCurrentScenario

      public ScenarioNr getCurrentScenario()
      Retrieves the current scenario of the simulation. The current scenario represents the specific phase or condition the simulation is currently in, which may influence gameplay, mission objectives, or other aspects of the simulation process.
      Specified by:
      getCurrentScenario in interface SimulationI
      Returns:
      the current scenario of type ScenarioNr that corresponds to the current phase or state of the simulation.

    • getEnemies

      public LinkedList<Enemy> getEnemies()
      Retrieves the list of enemies currently present in the simulation. The list contains all enemies currently active and relevant within the game's battlefield.
      Specified by:
      getEnemies in interface SimulationI
      Returns:
      a LinkedList of Enemy objects representing the enemies in the simulation.

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer()
      Retrieves the player associated with the current simulation.
      Specified by:
      getPlayer in interface SimulationI
      Returns:
      the Player object representing the player in the simulation.

    • getMission

      public Mission getMission()
      Retrieves the mission associated with the current simulation.
      Specified by:
      getMission in interface SimulationI
      Returns:
      the Mission object representing the mission details of the simulation.

    • getNextObjective

      public Room getNextObjective()
      Retrieves the next objective room for the simulation. The next objective represents the target room that the player is currently tasked to move toward or interact with during the mission.
      Specified by:
      getNextObjective in interface SimulationI
      Returns:
      the Room object representing the next objective in the simulation.

    • setEntryPoint

      public void setEntryPoint​(Room entryPoint)
      Sets the entry point for the simulation. The entry point represents the starting room or location in the battlefield where the simulation begins.
      Specified by:
      setEntryPoint in interface SimulationI
      Parameters:
      entryPoint - The Room object representing the entry point for the simulation.

    • setNextObjective

      public void setNextObjective​(Room nextObjective)
      Sets the next objective for the current entity.
      Specified by:
      setNextObjective in interface SimulationI
      Parameters:
      nextObjective - The Room object representing the next objective to be assigned.

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Checks whether the current game state indicates that the game is over.
      Specified by:
      isGameOver in interface SimulationI
      Returns:
      true if the game is over, false otherwise.

    • getCurrentTurn

      public Turn getCurrentTurn()
      Retrieves the current turn of the game or application.
      Specified by:
      getCurrentTurn in interface SimulationI
      Returns:
      the current turn as a Turn object

    • findBestEntryPoint

      public Room findBestEntryPoint() throws ElementNotFoundException
      Identifies and returns the best entry point for the mission based on the shortest path with the minimal calculated damage to the next objective. It evaluates all entry/exit points provided by the mission and determines the optimal entry point by iterating over the battlefield network.
      Returns:
      The Room object representing the best entry point with minimal damage to the next objective. Returns null if no suitable entry point is found.
      Throws:
      ElementNotFoundException - if the battlefield network or paths are invalid or the objective cannot be located.

    • bestExtractionPoint

      public Room bestExtractionPoint​(Room playerPosition) throws ElementNotFoundException
      Determines the best extraction point for the player based on the minimal path damage from the player's current position to each extraction point in the mission.
      Parameters:
      playerPosition - The current position of the player in the battlefield.
      Returns:
      The room representing the extraction point with the minimal damage path from the player's position.
      Throws:
      ElementNotFoundException - If no valid path or extraction point is found in the mission.

    • calculatePathDamage

      public double calculatePathDamage​(java.util.Iterator<Room> path)
      Calculates the total damage a player would take while traversing a given path. The method processes each room in the path and considers encounters with enemies and the effects of items like MediKits and Kevlar.
      Parameters:
      path - an iterator of Room objects representing the path to traverse. Each room may contain enemies or items that affect the player's health.
      Returns:
      the total damage dealt to the player during the traversal.

    • setReturningToExtraction

      public void setReturningToExtraction​(boolean returningToExtraction)
      Sets the value indicating whether the system is returning to the extraction phase.
      Parameters:
      returningToExtraction - the boolean value to set; true if returning to extraction, false otherwise
